patterns_discovered.description: Systematic replacement of physical CSS properties (left/right/ml/mr) with logical equivalents (insetInlineStart/insetInlineEnd/marginInlineStart/marginInlineEnd)
Implementation of CSS Logical Properties standard for RTL/LTR language support
Consistent use of inset* properties instead of individual top/left/right/bottom for absolute positioned elements
Directional properties applied to dynamic/calculated margin values (e.g., level * 3)
patterns_discovered.example: marginInlineStart: level * 3 in AreasPage tree structure

gotchas_discovered.description: Codebase still uses physical properties in some contexts (top/bottom preserved, only left/right converted to logical)
gotchas_discovered.impact: Partial RTL support - vertical properties don't need directional equivalents but horizontal must be logical
gotchas_discovered.note: This is correct behavior - top/bottom are not directional

gotchas_discovered.description: CSS logical shorthand properties have limited browser support compared to individual properties
gotchas_discovered.current_approach: Using individual insetInlineStart/insetInlineEnd rather than inset shorthand

gotchas_discovered.description: Multiplying margin values dynamically (level * 3) with logical properties requires understanding that marginInlineStart still respects calc() and arithmetic
Star icon positioning at 'right: 16' requires insetInlineEnd awareness - developers must remember RTL will automatically flip
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Document that insetInlineEnd automatically mirrors in RTL
